import React, { useRef, useState } from 'react' import { useForm } from 'react-hook-form' import { Modal, ModalHeader, ModalBody, ModalFooter, Button, Input, Label } from '@windmill/react-ui' import { addDoc, collection, doc, setDoc, Timestamp } from 'firebase/firestore' import { db } from '../../utils/firebase' import { subtle } from 'crypto' import { async } from '@firebase/util' function ModalFormRole({ closeModal, isModalOpen }) { const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm() const handleData = async (e) => { try { await addDoc(collection(db, 'tasks'), e) onClose() } catch (err) { alert(err) } } const onSubmit = (e) => { handleData(e) console.log("data", e); } return ( <> Form Data Role
{/* I don't like this approach. Consider passing a prop to ModalFooter * that if present, would duplicate the buttons in a way similar to this. * Or, maybe find some way to pass something like size="large md:regular" * to Button */}
) } export default ModalFormRole
